q: Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.
h:
“Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.” —
Mark Twain

q: Instead of thinking about what you are going to do when you retire, think about how you can do that now and make a living from it.
h:
“Instead of thinking about what you are going to do when you retire, think about how you can do that now and make a living from it.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.
h:
“Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.” —
George Eliot

q: A Hero is an ordinary individual who finds the strength to persevere and endure in spite of overwhelming obstacles.
h:
“A Hero is an ordinary individual who finds the strength to persevere and endure in spite of overwhelming obstacles.” —
Christopher Reeve

q: Be the silent watcher of your thoughts and behavior. You are beneath the thinker.
h:
“Be the silent watcher of your thoughts and behavior. You are beneath the thinker.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
h:
“He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary. ” —
Seneca

q: Not all those who wander are lost.
h:
“Not all those who wander are lost.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Better a diamond with a flaw than a pebble without one.
h:
“Better a diamond with a flaw than a pebble without one.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: If you always do what you've always done, you'll always get what you've always got.
h:
“If you always do what you've always done, you'll always get what you've always got. ” —
Henry Ford

q: The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.
h:
“The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: You find peace not by rearranging the circumstances of your life, but by realizing who you are at the deepest level.
h:
“You find peace not by rearranging the circumstances of your life, but by realizing who you are at the deepest level.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: The sculptor produces the beautiful statue by chipping away such parts of the marble block as are not needed - it is a process of elimination.
h:
“The sculptor produces the beautiful statue by chipping away such parts of the marble block as are not needed - it is a process of elimination.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: Never feel shame for trying and failing, for he who has never failed is he who has never tried.
h:
“Never feel shame for trying and failing, for he who has never failed is he who has never tried.” —
Og Mandino

q: Find something you love and do it better than everyone else.
h:
“Find something you love and do it better than everyone else.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: Nothing is more real than nothing.
h:
“Nothing is more real than nothing.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: It is not the knowing that is difficult, but the doing.
h:
“It is not the knowing that is difficult, but the doing. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.
h:
“A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: It's better to dance than to march through life.
h:
“It's better to dance than to march through life.” —
Yoko Ono

q: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
h:
“I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.” —
Nelson Mandela

q: Care about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner.
h:
“Care about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner.” —
Lao Tzu

q: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
h:
“A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.” —
Lao Tzu

q: The only difference between success and failure is the ability to take action.
h:
“The only difference between success and failure is the ability to take action.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: Do not regret the past. Look to the future.
h:
“Do not regret the past. Look to the future.” —
Soyen Shaku

q: Some people dream of success, while others wake up and work hard at it.
h:
“Some people dream of success, while others wake up and work hard at it.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always comes around to where you started again.
h:
“Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always comes around to where you started again.” —
Stephen King

q: Every day is lost in which we do not learn something useful. Man has no nobler or more valuable possession than time.
h:
“Every day is lost in which we do not learn something useful. Man has no nobler or more valuable possession than time.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: I will not walk backward in life.
h:
“I will not walk backward in life.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
h:
“No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.” —
Alan Watts

q: Make no small plans for they have no power to stir the soul.
h:
“Make no small plans for they have no power to stir the soul.” —
Niccolo Machiavelli

q: Don't seek, don't search, don't ask, don't knock, don't demand – relax.
h:
“Don't seek, don't search, don't ask, don't knock, don't demand – relax.” —
Osho

q: We shape clay into a pot, but it is the emptiness inside that holds whatever we want.
h:
“We shape clay into a pot, but it is the emptiness inside that holds whatever we want.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.
h:
“Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.
h:
“Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.” —
John Wooden

q: When you realize you've made a mistake, take immediate steps to correct it.
h:
“When you realize you've made a mistake, take immediate steps to correct it.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Your past does not equal your future.
h:
“Your past does not equal your future.” —
Tony Robbins

q: The wisest men follow their own direction.
h:
“The wisest men follow their own direction.” —
Euripides

q: Opportunity comes when you continually push forward.
h:
“Opportunity comes when you continually push forward.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.
h:
“Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.
h:
“Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Never take your position for granted and never let any favors you receive go to your head.
h:
“Never take your position for granted and never let any favors you receive go to your head.” —
Robert Greene

q: Force has no place where there is need of skill.
h:
“Force has no place where there is need of skill. ” —
Herodotus

q: In all human affairs there are efforts, and there are results, and the strength of the effort is the measure of the result.
h:
“In all human affairs there are efforts, and there are results, and the strength of the effort is the measure of the result.” —
James Allen

q: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
h:
“Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: The chief cause of failure and unhappiness is trading what you want most for what you want right now.
h:
“The chief cause of failure and unhappiness is trading what you want most for what you want right now.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Life is trying things to see if they work.
h:
“Life is trying things to see if they work.” —
Ray Bradbury

q: Whenever you do a thing, act as if all the world were watching.
h:
“Whenever you do a thing, act as if all the world were watching.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
h:
“You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.” —
William Faulkner

q: Fear does not have any special power unless you empower it by submitting to it.
h:
“Fear does not have any special power unless you empower it by submitting to it.” —
Les Brown

q: Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other.
h:
“Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other.” —
Dalai Lama

q: A good teacher opens the door for you, but you must enter the room by yourself.
h:
“A good teacher opens the door for you, but you must enter the room by yourself.” —
Zen Proverb
